IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: OPERATION OF AN INDEPENDENT COLLEGE PREPARATORY SCHOOL FOR STUDENTS IN GRADES 6 - 12 AND POSTGRADUATES DEDICATED TO PROMOTING SELF-DEVELOPMENT AND EDUCATION.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WORCESTER ACADEMY EXISTS TO INSTILL IN ITS STUDENTS THE DESIRE TO LEARN THROUGHOUT LIFE, TO ENGAGE PASSIONATELY WITH THE WORLD AROUND THEM, AND TO BE HONORABLE PERSONS OF STRONG AND RESOURCEFUL CHARACTER.
IRS990.Desc: OPERATION OF PREPARATORY SCHOOL FOR APPOXIMATELY 600 STUDENTS IN GRADES 6 - 12 AND POSTGRADUATES.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: SUMMER PROGRAMS BENEFITING APPROXIMATELY 500 STUDENTS AGES 7 - 14.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. ITS ENDOWMENT INCLUDES BOTH DONOR RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS. AS REQUIRED BY GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, NET ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE CLASSIFIED AND REPORTED BASED ON THE EXISTENCE OR ABSENCE OF DONOR-IMPOSED OR LEGAL RESTRICTIONS. ENDOWMENT FUNDS INCLUDE INVESTED GIFTS. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS INTERPRETED THE PROVISIONS OF THE UNIFORM PRUDENT MANAGEMENT OF INSTITUTIONAL FUNDS ACT (UPMIFA) AS REQUIRING THE PRESERVATION OF THE FAIR VALUE OF THE ORIGINAL GIFT AS OF THE GIFT DATE OF THE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS ABSENT EXPLICIT DONOR STIPULATIONS OF THE CONTRARY. AS A RESULT OF THE INTERPRETATION, THE SCHOOL CLASSIFIES AS PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS THE ORIGINAL VALUE OF GIFTS DONATED TO THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT AND ACCUMULATIONS TO THE PERMANENT ENDOWMENT IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE DONOR GIFT INSTRUMENT AT THE TIME THE ACCUMULATION IS ADDED TO THE FUND. THE REMAINING PORTION OF THE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUND THAT IS NOT CLASSIFIED IN PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS IS CLASSIFIED AS TEMPORARILY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS UNTIL THOSE AMOUNTS ARE APPROPRIATED FOR EXPENDITURE BY THE SCHOOL IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THE STANDARD OF PRUDENCE PRESCRIBED BY UPMIFA. IN ACCORDANCE WITH UPMIFA, THE SCHOOL CONSIDERED THE FOLLOWING FACTORS IN MAKING A DETERMINATION TO APPROPRIATE OR ACCUMULATE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS: 1 - THE DURATION AND PRESERVATION OF VARIOUS FUNDS; 2 - THE PURPOSES OF THE DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS; 3 - GENERAL ECONOMIC CONDITIONS; 4 - THE POSSIBLE EFFECT OF INFLATION AND DEFLATION; 5 - THE EXPECTED TOTAL RETURN FROM INCOME AND THE APPRECIATION OF INVESTMENTS; 6 - OTHER RESOURCES OF THE SCHOOL; AND 7 - THE SCHOOL'S INVESTMENT POLICIES. THE SCHOOL HAS ADOPTED INVESTMENT AND SPENDING POLICIES, APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, FOR ENDOWMENT FUNDS THAT STRIVE TO PROVIDE A STABLE SOURCE OF RETURNS TO SUPPORT THE ONGOING OPERATION AND ACTIVITIES OF THE SCHOOL WHILE SEEKING TO ACHIEVE A LONG-TERM RATE OF RETURN THROUGH BOTH CAPITAL APPRECIATION AND INVESTMENT YIELDS SUFFICIENT TO PRODUCE REAL GROWTH OF FUND ASSETS, NET OF SPENDING REQUIREMENTS, INFLATION AND INVESTMENT EXPENSES. ENDOWMENT FUNDS ARE INVESTED IN A DIVERSIFIED ASSET MIX, WHICH IS INTENDED TO RESULT IN A CONSISTENT INFLATION-PROTECTED RATE OF RETURN AND SUFFICIENT LIQUIDITY TO MAKE ANNUAL DISTRIBUTIONS AS DETERMINED BY COMMITTEES OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. THE SCHOOL TARGETS A DIVERSIFIED ASSET ALLOCATION AND MANAGES ITS INVESTMENT STRATEGIES TO ACHIEVE ITS OBJECTIVES WITHIN PRUDENT RISK CONSTRAINTS. THE SCHOOL'S ANNUAL SPENDING APPROPRIATION IS DETERMINED BY THE FINANCE COMMITTEE IN CONSULTATION WITHIN THE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE USING AVERAGE MARKET VALUES AND INVESTMENT RETURNS FOR THE PREVIOUS THREE YEARS. FROM TIME TO TIME, THE FAIR VALUE OF ASSETS ASSOCIATED WITH INDIVIDUAL DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS MAY FALL BELOW THE LEVEL THAT THE DONOR-IMPOSED RESTRICTIONS REQUIRE THE SCHOOL TO RETAIN AS A FUND OF PERPETUAL DURATION. IN ACCORDANCE WITH GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES, DEFICIENCIES OF THIS NATURE ARE REPORTED IN UNRESTRICTED NET ASSETS. SUCH DEFICIENCIES AMOUNTED TO ($41,274) AS OF JUNE 30, 2016.

MANAGEMENT ANNUALLY REVIEWS FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ALONG WITH ANY RELATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES AND BELIEVES THAT THE SCHOOL HAS NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD HAVE A MATERIAL ADVERSE EFFECT, INDIVIDUALLY OR IN THE AGGREGATE UPON THE SCHOOL'S STATEMENTS OF FINANCIAL POSITION, OR THE RELATED STATEMENTS OF ACTIVITIES, OR CASH FLOWS.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST -571,899. WORKERS COMP INSURANCE REBATE 15,843.
WORKERS COMP INSURANCE REBATE 15,843. BAD DEBT EXPENSE 88,570.

THE POLICY IS INCLUDED ON THE WEBSITE AND IS PRINTED IN THE "VIEW BOOK" WHICH IS DISTRIBUTED AT OPEN HOUSES AND SENT TO ALL INDIVIDUALS REQUESTING SCHOOL INFORMATION. THE POLICY IS ALSO PUBLISHED ANNUALLY IN THE BOSTON GLOBE (W/ AISNE SCHOOLS).

WORCESTER ACADEMY IS FULLY COMMITTED TO ENROLLING A DIVERSE STUDENT BODY; DIVERSE IN TERMS OF INTERESTS, TALENTS, RACE, ETHNICITY AND ECONOMIC BACKGROUND. TO THIS END, THE ACADEMY HAS DEVELOPED A FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM TO PROMOTE ACCESS TO THE ACADEMY TO ALL QUALIFIED STUDENTS, REGARDLESS OF FAMILY FINANCIAL CIRCUMSTANCES. THE GOAL OF OUR FINANCIAL AID PROGRAM IS TO LESSEN THE GAP, BETWEEN WHAT A FAMILY CAN REASONABLY BE EXPECTED TO CONTRIBUTE AND WHAT IT ACTUALLY COSTS TO ATTEND WORCESTER ACADEMY. FINANCIAL AID IS AN ANNUAL AWARD AND STUDENTS MUST APPLY EACH YEAR FOR SUPPORT.

THE HEAD MASTER RECEIVED THE FOLLOWING: (1) COMPANION TRAVEL; TRAVEL WITH WIFE FOR ALUMNI EVENTS; (2) RESIDENCE; ON CAMPUS HOUSING IS REQUIRED FOR HEAD OF SCHOOL; (3) VEHICLE LEASE ALLOWANCE AND 4) PERSONAL SERVICES: CLEANING SERVICES FOR CAMPUS HOUSING.
NO WRITTEN POLICY IS IN PLACE FOR THE BENEFITS PROVIDED TO THE HEAD OF THE SCHOOL LISTED ABOVE. HOWEVER, THESE ARE LONG STANDING PRACTICES OF THE SCHOOL.

IN 2016, THE SCHOOL ESTABLISHED A DEFINED CONTRIBUTION RESTIREMENT PLAN FOR THE HEAD MASTER. THE SCHOOL'S CONTRIBUITON TO THE PLAN IS EQUAL TO THE SCHOOL'S CONTRIBUTION TO THE DEFINED CONTRIBUTION RETIREMENT ANNUITY PLAN FOR HIM. THE SCHOOL'S CONTRIBUTION TO THIS PLAN FOR THE CURRENT YEAR WAS $17,000.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: REFINANCE OF 2010 BOND AND CONSTRUCTION PROJECT FINANCINGS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: INVESTMENT FIRM RECEIVES AND SELLS MARKETABLE SECURITIES RECEIVED AS CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN ELECTRONIC COPY OF THE RETURN IS PROVIDED TO A SUBCOMMITTEE OF THE BOARD VIA SECURE FILE TRANSFER.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL HAS ADOPTED A CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY THAT REQUIRES EACH DIRECTOR, PRINCIPAL OFFICER AND MEMBER OF A COMMITTEE WITH GOVERNING BOARD DESIGNATED POWERS TO ANNUALLY SIGN A STATEMENT WHICH AFFIRMS THEY HAVE RECEIVED A COPY OF THE POLICY, UNDERSTAND THE POLICY, AGREE TO COMPLY WITH THE POLICY AND UNDERSTAND THAT THE SCHOOL IS CHARITABLE AND IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN ITS FEDERAL TAX EXEMPTION IT MUST ENGAGE PRIMARILY IN ACTIVITIES WHICH ACCOMPLISH ONE OR MORE OF ITS TAX-EXEMPT PURPOSES. THE POLICY DEFINES INTEREST PERSON, FINANCIAL INTEREST AND DISCUSSES VARIOUS FORMS OF COMPENSATION AND THEIR DUTIES TO DISCLOSE IF CONFLICTS EXIST.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL COMPARES INFORMATION AVAILABLE WITH NAIS AND SIMILIAR POSITIONS IN OTHER ORGANIZATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL GENERALLY DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF BENEFICIAL INTEREST IN TRUSTS -571,899. BAD DEBT EXPENSE -88,570.
